articles.headline: Bernie Sanders Facing Pressure Over Supporters’ Actions in Nevada
articles.snippet: Senator Harry Reid said he had spoken with Mr. Sanders about accusations that his backers made death threats after Nevada Democrats ruled against them.
articles.abstract: Senator Harry Reid said he had spoken with Mr. Sanders about accusations that his backers made death threats after Nevada Democrats ruled against them.
articles.lead_paragraph: Raising the prospect of lasting fissures in the party, Senator Bernie Sanders rebuffed pressure on Tuesday to rein in his supporters after they disrupted a weekend Democratic convention in Nevada, throwing chairs and later threatening the state chairwoman in a fight over delegates. The uproar comes as Hillary Clinton is struggling to turn her and the party’s attention to the fall.

articles.headline: Transgender Bathroom Debate Turns Personal at a Vermont High School
articles.snippet: An announcement supporting a transgender student’s use of the restroom of his choice has divided students and parents in Chester.
articles.abstract: An announcement supporting a transgender student’s use of the restroom of his choice has divided students and parents in Chester.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHESTER, Vt. — The way A J Jackson tells it, he kept his head ducked down and pretended to fiddle with his cellphone as he walked into the boys’ bathroom and headed for a stall at Green Mountain Union High School here.

articles.headline: A Growth Rate Weighed Down by Inaction
articles.snippet: Unless business and government do something to improve the economy’s capability, the United States will be stuck with anemic rates of growth.
articles.abstract: Unless business and government do something to improve the economy’s capability, the United States will be stuck with anemic rates of growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: Back when “Gunsmoke” was on TV and Lyndon Johnson was president, the United States economy managed to storm ahead by nearly 5 percent a year for nearly a decade. What we would give to recover some of that power!

articles.headline: A Supreme Court Not So Much Deadlocked as Diminished
articles.snippet: Since the death of Antonin Scalia, the court has seen a push for consensus and minimalist rulings under the leadership of Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr.
articles.abstract: Since the death of Antonin Scalia, the court has seen a push for consensus and minimalist rulings under the leadership of Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court has gone into hibernation, withdrawing from the central role it has played in American life throughout Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr.’s decade on the court.

articles.headline: Facebook Moves to Repair Its Fractured Relationship With the Right
articles.snippet: The social network, which had already been criticized for the voicing of liberal views by top executives, is now rebutting claims that its news curators engaged in anti-conservative bias.
articles.abstract: The social network, which had already been criticized for the voicing of liberal views by top executives, is now rebutting claims that its news curators engaged in anti-conservative bias.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Hours after the publication of a news report last week accusing Facebook of anti-conservative bias, the company’s top Republican executive moved into damage-control mode.

articles.headline: An Ad Buyer’s Busy Day as a Target of the TV Upfronts
articles.snippet: Elaborate presentations, lunches, dinners and parties are part of the television upfronts, when the networks present their fall programming hoping to seal $9 billion in ad sales.
articles.abstract: Elaborate presentations, lunches, dinners and parties are part of the television upfronts, when the networks present their fall programming hoping to seal $9 billion in ad sales.
articles.lead_paragraph: Every year for decades, advertising executives from across the country have flocked to New York for the feeding frenzy known as the television upfronts. During elaborate presentations at some of the city’s most celebrated locations, TV networks present their slate of programming for the next fall season to advertisers. The goal this year: Attract what could amount to more than $9 billion in advance ad sales.

articles.headline: White House Increases Overtime Eligibility by Millions
articles.snippet: A rule to be issued by the Labor Department will state that most salaried workers earning up to $47,476 a year must receive overtime pay when they work more than 40 hours.
articles.abstract: A rule to be issued by the Labor Department will state that most salaried workers earning up to $47,476 a year must receive overtime pay when they work more than 40 hours.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Obama administration, in a far-reaching effort to improve the lot of workers that has ignited criticism from business groups, announced on Tuesday that it was making millions more employees eligible for overtime pay.

articles.headline: In Japan’s Slow Economy, Rare Price Rise Prompts Surplus of Remorse
articles.snippet: An ad apologizing for the higher cost of an ice cream bar reflects the vicious cycle of falling prices and incomes as the country’s economy struggles.
articles.abstract: An ad apologizing for the higher cost of an ice cream bar reflects the vicious cycle of falling prices and incomes as the country’s economy struggles.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — One of the most talked-about television commercials in Japan this year advertises an unusual product: contrition.

articles.headline: Twitter, Trump’s Trusty Weapon, Could Backfire
articles.snippet: The social media platform has served Mr. Trump’s bombast and provocations well, but such behavior may be poison to a general election campaign.
articles.abstract: The social media platform has served Mr. Trump’s bombast and provocations well, but such behavior may be poison to a general election campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: You may have heard the theory that Silicon Valley has been instrumental in the rise of Donald J. Trump.

articles.headline: Victims of Boko Haram, and Now Shunned by Their Communities
articles.snippet: Nigerians who return from captivity after being kidnapped and raped by Boko Haram are met with suspicion that they have joined the militants’ ranks.
articles.abstract: Nigerians who return from captivity after being kidnapped and raped by Boko Haram are met with suspicion that they have joined the militants’ ranks.
articles.lead_paragraph: DALORI, Nigeria — Zara and her little brother thought they were finally safe.
